free.jin
Class Seek

java.lang.Object
  free.util.Struct
      free.jin.Seek

public class Seek
extends Struct

A representation of a seek - a request for a player to play a game

Constructor Summary

          Creates a new Seek with the given properties.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getID()
          Returns the ID of the game - this is something that should probably be displayed to the user.
 int getInc()
          Returns the amount of time added to each player's clock after he moves in the sought game, in milliseconds.
 int getMaxRating()
          Returns the maximum rating against which the player who issued the seek is willing to play.

          Returns the minimum rating against which the player who issued the seek is willing to play.

Constructor Detail

Seek

public Seek(java.lang.String seekID,
            java.lang.String seeker,
            java.lang.String seekerTitle,
            int rating,
            boolean isProvisional,
            boolean isRegistered,
            boolean isSeekerRated,
            boolean isComputer,
            WildVariant variant,
            java.lang.String ratingCategoryString,
            int time,
            int inc,
            boolean isRated,
            Player color,
            boolean isRatingLimited,
            int minRating,
            int maxRating,
            boolean isManualAccept,
            boolean isFormula)
Creates a new Seek with the given properties.

Parameters:
seekID - A string identifying the game for the user.
seeker - The handle of the player who issued the seek.
seekerTitle - The title of the player who issued the seek.
rating - The rating of the player who issued the seek.
isProvisional - Is the rating of the player who issued the seek provisional?
isRegistered - Is the seeker a registered player or a guest?
isComputer - Is the seeker a computer player or a human?
variant - The WildVariant of the sought game.
ratingCategoryString - The name of the rating category to which the sought game belongs.
time - The amount of time on each player's clock when the game starts, in milliseconds.
inc - The increment to each player's clock after each move, in milliseconds.
isRated - True if the sought game is rated.
color - The side on which the seeking player wants to be - Player.WHITE_PLAYER if the seek is to play with white pieces, Player.BLACK_PLAYER if with black or null if the seek is for a random color.
isRatingLimited - Is the seeker limiting the rating of the players against whom he wants to play. If this is false, the minRating and maxRating parameters will be ignored.
minRating - The minimum rating against which the seeking player is willing to play.
maxRating - The maximum rating against which the seeking player is willing to play.
isManualAccept - True if the seeking player wishes to manually confirm that he wants to play against whoever accepts his seek.
isFormula - True if in order to start the game, you must pass the seeking player's formula.
Method Detail

getID

public java.lang.String getID()
Returns the ID of the game - this is something that should probably be displayed to the user.

getSeekerName

public java.lang.String getSeekerName()
Returns the handle/nickname of the player who issued the seek.

getSeekerTitle

public java.lang.String getSeekerTitle()
Returns the title of the player who issued the seek.

getSeekerRating

public int getSeekerRating()
Returns the rating of the player who issued the seek.

isSeekerProvisional

public boolean isSeekerProvisional()
Returns true if the rating of the player who issued the seek is provisional, false otherwise.

isSeekerRegistered

public boolean isSeekerRegistered()
Returns true if the player who issued the seek is a registered player, false if he's a guest.

isSeekerRated

public boolean isSeekerRated()
Returns true if the seeker is rated (has a rating), false otherwise.

isSeekerComputer

public boolean isSeekerComputer()
Returns true if the player who issued the seek is a computer player, false if he's human.

getVariant

public WildVariant getVariant()
Returns the WildVariant of the sought game.

getRatingCategoryString

public java.lang.String getRatingCategoryString()
Returns a String identifying the rating category of the game - this should probably be displayed to the user.

getTime

public int getTime()
Returns the amount of time on each player's clock at the start of the sought game, in milliseconds.

getInc

public int getInc()
Returns the amount of time added to each player's clock after he moves in the sought game, in milliseconds.

isRated

public boolean isRated()
Returns true if the sought game is rated, false otherwise.

getSoughtColor

public Player getSoughtColor()
Returns a Player object representing what color the player who issued the seek wants to play. This is null if the game will have a random color.

isRatingLimited

public boolean isRatingLimited()
Returns true if the seeker is limiting the rating of the players against whom he wants to play. If this is false, the min rating and max rating properties should be ignored.

getMinRating

public int getMinRating()
Returns the minimum rating against which the player who issued the seek is willing to play.

getMaxRating

public int getMaxRating()
Returns the maximum rating against which the player who issued the seek is willing to play.

isManualAccept

public boolean isManualAccept()
Returns true if the player who issued the seek wants to manually confirm that he wants to play whoever accepts his seek.

isFormula

public boolean isFormula()
Returns true if the player who wants to accept the seek must pass the formula of the player who issued the seek.
